greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ways to express 3/n as Egyptian fractions in just three terms; i.e., 3/n = 1/x + 1/y + 1/z satisfying 1<=x<=y<=z.
comment: See A073101 for the 4/n conjecture due to Erdős and Straus.
mathematica: f[n_] := Length@ Solve[ 3/n == 1/x + 1/y + 1/z && 1 <= x <= y <= z, {x, y, z}, Integers]; Array[f, 70]
results.author: _Allan C. Wechsler_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 17 2013
